msContents.summary: Daily account of receipts and expenditures for Choiak 27 to Tybi 1; these two columns were followed by PSI VI 625 and P.Cair.Zen. IV 59799 which contain the account for the rest of Tybi

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers with 35 lines; in the back, across the fibers, 2 unrelated numbers written by a different larger hand
Two cols.; at the end of the second there is a large blank space
The account was folded four times and the marks are very evident

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 13 in Bell's inventory

[Col. I:] [Choiak] 27 12 drachmas 1 3/4 obols 28 10 drachmas 7 chalkoi 29 11 drachmas 1 obol 5 chalkoi 30 13 drachmas 2 obols Tybi 1 17 drachmas 21/4 obols
Total 64 drachmas 2 1/4 obols
Expenditures: [Choiak] 27 4 drachmas 1 obol 28 4 drachmas 1 obol and to the brickmakers: to Chaiapis, for 20,000 bricks, 30 drachmas to Harmais, for the same, 30 drachmas to Teos 30 drachmas to Nechthenibis 15 drachmas Total 113 drachmas 2 obols 29 to workmen 4 drachmas 1/4 obol and to Chaiapis, for transporting 10,000 bricks, 14 drachmas 30 to workmen 4 drachmas 1/2 obol, an extra 1/4 obol and castor oil, for prepara- tion of the copper pots during the night when they baked: on the 14th, 2 kotylai, 4 obols [Col. II:] and on the 16th, 1 kotyle, 2 obols and from the 17th to the 30th, per day 1 kotyle, total, 1 chous 2 kot lai, 4 drachmas 4 obols Total 27 drachmas 4 3/4 obols Tybi 1 to workmen 4 drachmas 1/4 obol and to 2 workmen who were cutting anouchi 2 obols Total 4 drachmas 2 1/4 obols Remainder 18 drachmas 1 obol 3 chalkoi [Verso, 2d hand:] 11 1
